info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 03 at 7:52AM EST by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...An area of thunderstorms will impact portions of Camden, Pasquotank, Perquimans, Bertie, southern Hertford, southeastern Gates, Currituck and Chowan Counties through 830 AM EST... At 750 AM EST, Doppler radar was tracking an area of thunderstorm over Windsor, moving east at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and rainfall amounts between one to two inches. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Currituck, Elizabeth City, Camden, Ahoskie, Windsor, Hertford, Aulander, Winfall, Elizabeth City State University, Ryland, Weeksville, Grandy, Lewiston Woodville, Powellsville, Roxobel, Colerain, Harrellsville, Cape Colony, Tyner and Snug Harbor. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Strong wind gusts are possible with these storms. These wind gusts are capable of knocking down tree limbs, small or weakened trees, and blowing around trash cans, potted plants, lawn furniture, and other light outdoor objects. Heavy downpours are also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
